title: Sadang station
text:
Sadang Station is a station on the <a href="Seoul%20Subway%20Line%202">Seoul Subway Line 2</a> and <a href="Seoul%20Subway%20Line%204">Seoul Subway Line 4</a> in <a href="South%20Korea">South Korea</a>.
Sadang Station has one <a href="island%20platform">island platform</a> for Line 4 and two <a href="side%20platform">side platform</a>s for Line 2. The Line 2 platforms of this station were the first in South Korea to have <a href="platform%20screen%20doors">platform screen doors</a> installed, on October 21, 2005. This station is the southern terminus for Line 4 trains that belong to the <a href="Seoul%20Metro">Seoul Metro</a>.
Both platform levels are located in Sadang-dong, Dongjak-gu, Seoul.
Passenger load.
In a survey conducted in 2011 by the <a href="Ministry%20of%20Land%2C%20Transport%20and%20Maritime%20Affairs">Ministry of Land, Transport and Maritime Affairs</a> on 92 <a href="Administrative%20divisions%20of%20South%20Korea">administrative divisions</a> across the country, it reported that Sadang Station is the third-busiest public transit stop following <a href="Gangnam%20Station">Gangnam Station</a> and <a href="Jamsil%20Station">Jamsil Station</a>. It is followed by <a href="Seolleung%20Station">Seolleung Station</a> and <a href="Sillim%20Station">Sillim Station</a>.
In December 2010 the station is recorded as having the second-highest WiFi data consumption of all the <a href="Seoul%20Metropolitan%20Subway">Seoul Metropolitan Subway</a> stations, following <a href="Express%20Bus%20Terminal%20Station%2C%20Seoul">Express Bus Terminal Station</a> and followed by <a href="Dongdaemun%20Station">Dongdaemun Station</a>, <a href="Jamsil%20Station">Jamsil Station</a> and <a href="Jongno%203-ga%20Station">Jongno 3(sam)-ga Station</a>.
